Half-Life (λ) - Это шедевр в его прямом виде, кардинально поменявший игровую индустрию. Играем мы за Гордона Фримена - Великого ученого с его превосходной монтировкой, который находится в научно-исследовательском комплексе под названием Black Mesa, и ему предстоит пройти очень сложный путь чтобы спасти мир. Пройдя игру на одном дыхании, полностью вникая в сюжет, я был поражен проработанностью механики игры, и игрового мира в целом, каждая деталь проработана до мелочей, впечатляет и по сей день, хотя игре уже давно не мало лет. Почти каждый объект можно разрушить, и это поражает. Сюжет очень интересный, практически в каждой главе открываешь для себя нового и хорошо запоминающегося персонажа, в том числе и новые виды оружия, к слову их тут достаточно. Великолепные локации с красивыми эффектами выглядят завораживающе. Полное отсутствие кат-сцен заставляет погрузиться в игру ещё больше. Слов не хватит чтобы описать этот шедевр, атмосферу не передать словами, абсолютно каждый геймер должен пройти эту игру. Это превосходная игра, VALVe поражают. Однозначно рекомендую!!!

Wybrany jako Gra Roku przez ponad 50 czasopism, jest to pierwszy tytuł Valve z tej serii, łączący elementy akcji i przygody, w którym zastosowano technologię umożliwiającą stworzenie niezwykle realistycznego świata, w którym gracze muszą myśleć, aby przeżyć. Gra zawiera tryb wieloosobowy pozwalający na prowadzenie potyczek z graczami z całego świata. Gracz wciela się w Gordona Freemana - fizyka jądrowego pracującego na oddziale Lambda w Black Mesa Research Facility. Podczas przeprowadzania eksperymentu coś idzie nie tak i powoduje to otwarcie się portalu do Xen - wymiaru gdzie żyją inne strorzenia niż na naszej planecie i my jako Gordon musimy się wydostać z tej placówki.
Valve, I love your games. This games to RULE THEM AL- ok maybe not that but this game started your company and after all these years its still so good.

我是真没想到一款1998年的老游戏的流程长达18个小时，而这十八个小时还是我这个存档怪走几步就存一下通的，关卡解密等设置的很巧妙（内心经常：欸卧槽走这儿啊，欸卧槽这样都行？后来慢慢习惯），加上大量可破坏互动物品使得这款游戏放到至今仍是神作，在doom，quake火爆当年的时候它大胆突破将剧情和带着各种武器虐杀怪物的射击游戏合二为一，造就了今天仍不腐朽的神话
Mesmo após anos do seu lançamento, consegue ser desafiador, criativo e divertido.

Siempre he oído hablar de la saga Half-Life y nunca supe porqué es que era muy conocida o tan aclamada y cuando empecé mi aventura por el mundo del PC gaming vi en Steam una oferta para adquirir todos los juegos de Valve, la adquirí a principios del 2019 y a lo unico que habia jugado hasta ahora era CS-GO.

Yo tengo un amigo que siempre me decía que tenía que jugar a los Half-Life por que eran muy buenos pero yo fui medio prejuicioso con el tema de los gráficos y que ya era un juego viejo. Hasta que un día mi amigo me echó en cara que tengo un montón de juegos comprados y que nunca los jugue, me hizo hacer una lista con cosas por aún jugar y decidí empezar con este. No me arrepiento para nada es un juegazo.

Mi amigo me iba guiando por esta aventura, nos sacamos una cuantas risas y yo unos sustos, pero valió la pena, si piensas en comprarlo o no, no dudes más y hacelo, a parte es un juego muy icónico.

Aun me queda por Jugar al Half-Life 2 y sus 2 episodios.
El Half-Life: Blue Shift y el Half-Life: Opposing Force ya los jugue y voy a hacer sus respectivas reseñas pero como adelanto también recomiendo que se jueguen ya que complementa la historia de este.

Esta reseña se la dedico a mi amigo Lautaro ya que fue él quien me empujó a jugarlos, gracias.

Saludos.

Finally got around to playing this "classic" from 1998, and wow... just wow... what an utter disappointment.

I'd say this game aged poorly, but I have doubts it was any good to begin with.  While not the worst game I've played, not by a long-shot, it is still not something I'd recommend.

The first issue I had where the movement controls.  I've played arena shooters so I know what a fast running speed fells like.  However, it feels like Gordon is wearing roller skates in this game.  Combine that with the precision platforming, (yes in a FPS), and you have a formula for frustration.

The game also has some lousy signposting even for 1998 standards.

Then you have the enemies who do insane amounts of damage, especially at later levels, on even the easiest difficulty.  The hit detection can be wonky at times.  (Died on time to an enemy soldier despite me having his head right in my cross-hairs and firing full bore at nearly point blank range.) 

I lost count of the number of times I rolled my eyes at a cheap death.  It got boring.

I really tried to like this game.  I wanted to love it, but I can't.  It got so bad that in order to just finish it I activated cheats, I was so fed up.

I doubt I will ever replay this, and have no idea how this became a "classic."

4/10

5/10 (with cheats on)

I've never played the half-life series and always heard good things about them, but I didn't have the consoles growing up so I never played them. Playing this in 2020, I enjoyed it, reminded me of simpler times. But I wasn't particularly wowed by it. Or at least not enough to understand the hype around the series. Looking at other shooters of the time, South Park 64, Quake II, Tom Clancy's Rainbox Six, Dark Forces II, it really was impressive. I remember the graphics from Dark Forces and Rainbow Six, so Half life did shine among them I'm sure.

The game was fun, the story was lacking, the long line from start to finish being mostly seemless was nice. That said, while little details like microwaving the soup until it explodes, the vending machines, little bits of dialogue saying hi to Freeman... all that was nice, but I felt there was a distinct lack of story. I only knew that I was Gordon, I was going into work for something. Then I go press a button because someone told me and all hell breaks loose. Then for some reason we're the ones who HAVE to go and do a bunch of stuff. I guess it's because Gordon's the only one with the hazard suit on? Or because he's the only scientist who hits the range and gym? I'm not sure. But putting that aside, when there was small bits of exposition it was barely enough to tell you a vague objective and I often was doing puzzles because I saw them and figure'd I just needed to do it, not because anyone explained why. I did the whole rocket-kills-the-alien puzzle without having any idea WHY I was doing it and it was only after the alien died that I realized that I was doing that to open up the hole to travel some more. Then, the game ends in the way that it does and we're left with no particular answers or clues as to why this strange person is giving us a portal home or what they really want. Is it the mystery that got people intrigued? I don't understand. I hope that by playing the second game I'll get it some more, but while the first half-life is fun, and was unique in some ways, it just seems like a solid game to me and something to inspire a million decadeslong memes about half-life 3 never ever. I guess I'll learn more later.

"If you thought all action games were the same..."

"...Think again."
- Half-Life Box.

Absolute Poetry and the best way to describe the game. 

Half-Life isn't your Brother's quake, it isn't your papa's Doom, and it surely isn't your granddad's Wolf 3d. Half-Life is something else. The enemies are dangerous, always present, and their tactics always change. You can't just go in and shotgun a marine, then move on. No, because you will waste a lot of ammo on one of them, and by the time they are down, about 3 others have probably dog-piled you. You need to use every one of your weapons to their full effect, and find creative uses for all of them, in order to not only kill your enemies, but to also flush them from cover and into your gunfire. They know how to use their weapons like professionals (Because they're mostly army grunts), and you are nothing but a lonely scientist. What are you going to do to fight them?

Answer: Superior Intellect.

Because of this, Half-Life is an incredibly unique and fun action FPS which is doubtlessly timeless. While many prefer HL2, I will always have a soft spot for Half-life. And hey, if you are reading this review, then you can thank Half-Life for putting Valve on the map, and subsequently making Steam. So, there's that!

Half-Life is daunting, challenging, and tough as hell. But remember:

Run.
Shoot.
Think.
Live.

No exaggeration, one of the greatest games in history. The way cinephiles watch Citizen Cane or music fans listen to The Beatles anyone who cares about the history of video games have to play Half Life. It doesn't age well, especially in graphics, but in many ways this is among the most soulful games in the world
